trans-unit.source: Cloud services for the <token>azure_1</token> Automation API are collections of one or more automation accounts.
trans-unit.target: Cloud services for the <token>azure_1</token> Automation API are collections of one or more automation accounts.

trans-unit.source: The relationship between cloud services and automation accounts is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The relationship between cloud services and automation accounts is as follows:

trans-unit.source: A cloud service contains one or more automation accounts.
trans-unit.target: A cloud service contains one or more automation accounts.

trans-unit.source: Multiple automation accounts can share the same cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Multiple automation accounts can share the same cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Each automation account must be in a cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Each automation account must be in a cloud service.

trans-unit.source: You must have an existing cloud service first before you create an automation account for that cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You must have an existing cloud service first before you create an automation account for that cloud service.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>azure_2</token> management portal, however, cloud services are defined differently and are hosted services instead of collections.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>azure_2</token> management portal, however, cloud services are defined differently and are hosted services instead of collections.

trans-unit.source: This distinction is important to remember, as the cloud services that you create for automation accounts are not available in the portal and must be determined programmatically.
trans-unit.target: This distinction is important to remember, as the cloud services that you create for automation accounts are not available in the portal and must be determined programmatically.

trans-unit.source: The operations for these tasks return any response bodies only as XML.
trans-unit.target: The operations for these tasks return any response bodies only as XML.
